com.ftpos.library.smartpos.emv

Interface OnEmvResponse


  • public interface OnEmvResponse
    Copyright (C), 2015-2020,FEITIAN Technologies Co., Ltd. All rights reserved. Callback interface in the transaction processing process, the application needs to participate in processing related transactions.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onAppSelect(boolean reselect, java.util.List<CandidateAIDInfo> aidList)
      The EMV Kernel requires the cardholder to select an application from the list for the current transaction.
      void onDisplayPanInfo(java.lang.String pan)
      Kernel outputs data to App (App does not need to respond to this).
      void onEndProcess(int status, java.lang.String transData)
      Kernel notifies the App that the transaction is over (no response required).
      void onObtainData(int ins, byte[] data, byte[] dataInformation)
      The Kernel requests the App to pass in additional data elements.
      void onOnlineProcess(java.lang.String transData)
      Kernel notifies App that it needs to request authorization online from the card issuer.
      void onPinEntry(int cvmMethodID)
      The Kernel requires the cardholder to perform verification in accordance with the specified method.
      void onProcessInteractionPoint(int i)
      Transaction interaction point processing and return interface
      void onSearchCard()
      The kernel informs the application to search the card operation.
      void onSearchCardAgain()
      In a contactless transaction, when the card issuing bank needs to be updated, this method is called back and the user needs to present the card again.
      Amount onUpdateTransAmount()
      For IC card transactions, if the transaction amount is missing or invalid, the transaction amount can be updated through this interface.

    • Method Detail

      • onAppSelect

        void onAppSelect(boolean reselect,
                 java.util.List<CandidateAIDInfo> aidList)
        The EMV Kernel requires the cardholder to select an application from the list for the current transaction.
        Parameters:
        reselect - A Boolean value indicating whether the selection is repeated.
        aidList - AID candidate list.

      • onPinEntry

        void onPinEntry(int cvmMethodID)
        The Kernel requires the cardholder to perform verification in accordance with the specified method.
        Parameters:
        cvmMethodID - CVM authentication-related data. The value is: 01:Requires offline plaintext PIN. 02:Require online PIN. 04:Request to enter offline text PIN.

      • onOnlineProcess

        void onOnlineProcess(java.lang.String transData)
        Kernel notifies App that it needs to request authorization online from the card issuer.
        Parameters:
        transData - Transaction data required for online processing in the form of a set of TLV data.

      • onEndProcess

        void onEndProcess(int status,
                  java.lang.String transData)
        Kernel notifies the App that the transaction is over (no response required).
        Parameters:
        status - The status of the transaction. Refer to ErrCode.
        transData - Transaction confirmation message in the form of a set of TLV data.

      • onDisplayPanInfo

        void onDisplayPanInfo(java.lang.String pan)
        Kernel outputs data to App (App does not need to respond to this).
        Parameters:
        pan - PAN Number.

      • onSearchCard

        void onSearchCard()
        The kernel informs the application to search the card operation.

      • onSearchCardAgain

        void onSearchCardAgain()
        In a contactless transaction, when the card issuing bank needs to be updated, this method is called back and the user needs to present the card again.

      • onProcessInteractionPoint

        void onProcessInteractionPoint(int i)
        Transaction interaction point processing and return interface
        Parameters:
        i - Interaction point identification.Value is 1~9 1:FinalSelect 2:GetProcessOption 3:ReadRecord 4:OfflineDataAuthentication 5:ProcessLimit 6:CardHolderVerfy 7:TerminalRisk 8:TerminalActionAnalysis 9:IssuerAuthentication

      • onObtainData

        void onObtainData(int ins,
                  byte[] data,
                  byte[] dataInformation)
        The Kernel requests the App to pass in additional data elements.
        Parameters:
        ins - The types of operations that need to be performed. TLV_DATA = 1:For the onSendOut/onObtainData callback methods, the Kernel passes a set of TLV data to the App, currently used in the DE function in PayPass transaction. TAG_LIST = 5:For the onObtainData callback method, the Kernel passes a list of Tags to the App. DOL = 6:For the onObtainData callback method, the Kernel passes a DOL to the App.
        data - Data related to the request. In the general cases, what is passed here is a Tag of data elements. For example, the Kernel wants to know if a PAN is in the exception file, and here it need to pass in TAG_CUSTOM_PAN_IN_EXCEPTION_LIST ("\x1F\x3F").
        dataInformation - Additional information provided by Kernel. For Kernel, in order to obtain the required data elements from the App, it may be necessary to provide additional data first.

      • onUpdateTransAmount

        Amount onUpdateTransAmount()
        For IC card transactions, if the transaction amount is missing or invalid, the transaction amount can be updated through this interface.
        Returns:
        Amount class
